author: Eileen Sullivan
description: Layoffs and departures after pressure from the Trump administration have left sites struggling, with the remaining employees each doing the work of two or three people.
title: Park Service Is Left Short-Staffed in Peak Travel Season

author: Jesus Jiménez
description: School officials have demanded answers from federal agencies. It was the latest example of how locals have scrutinized the actions of immigration agents.
title: Immigration Agents Appear to Urinate in Public at a California School

author: Charlie Savage
description: In purporting to license otherwise illegal conduct by tech firms, President Trump set a precedent expanding executive power, legal experts warned.
title: How the Trump Administration Justified Ignoring the TikTok Ban

author: Benjamin Ryan, Nicholas Fandos and Dana Rubinstein
description: Zohran Mamdani, the Democrat running for mayor of New York City, was born in Uganda. He doesn’t consider himself Black but said the application didn’t allow for the complexity of his background.
title: Mamdani Identified as Asian and African American on College Application

author: Clay Risen
description: He brought order and profits to Marvel in the 1980s and helped establish the genre as a popular-culture tent pole for decades to come.
title: Jim Shooter, Editor Who ‘Saved the Comics Industry,’ Dies at 73

author: Matthew Cullen
description: Also, the U.S. labor market remained robust. Here’s the latest at the end of Thursday.
title: The House Passed Trump’s Big Bill, Showcasing His Power

author: Nicole Sperling
description: The Hollywood Foreign Press Association, which ran the awards show until a couple of years ago, has voted to investigate the deal that sold the event to a joint venture.
title: Dispute Over Golden Globes Heats Up

author: Adam Liptak and Mattathias Schwartz
description: The court’s order followed a broader one last month allowing removals to countries with which migrants have no connections.
title: Supreme Court Lets Trump Deport Eight Migrants to South Sudan

author: David Brooks
description: It’s not an education if A.I. does your thinking for you.
title: How A.I. Could Make Us Dumber

author: Catie Edmondson
description: Many Republicans had harshly criticized President Trump’s marquee bill extending tax cuts and slashing social safety net programs — almost right up until the moment they voted for it.
title: These Republicans Savaged Their Party’s Bill, Then Voted for It

author: Thomas L. Friedman
description: Beijing must be delighted by how the U.S. is surrendering the future of electricity to it.
title: How Trump’s ‘Big, Beautiful Bill’ Will Make China Great Again

author: Ben Sisario
description: A Manhattan man who did not deliberate but heard all 28 days of testimony said in an interview that he was not persuaded by the prosecution’s case.
title: Alternate Juror at the Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Trial: ‘I Understand’ the Verdict

author: Alex Williams
description: He had the air of a throwback actor, a timeless Hollywood heavy who seemed to have stepped out of a 1940s film noir.
title: Michael Madsen, Actor Known for ‘Reservoir Dogs’ and ‘Kill Bill,’ Dies at 67

author: Judson Jones
description: The National Hurricane Center is tracking a “disturbance” that could intensify in the coming days.
title: A Potential Tropical Depression Brings Heavy Rain To Florida

author: Zach Montague
description: The ruling cited a Supreme Court decision in May that allowed President Trump to sideline Democratic appointees from several other nonpartisan agencies.
title: Appeals Court Lets Trump Remove Another Democrat From Independent Agency

author: New York Times Opinion
description: Seven writers on the best and worst provisions in Trump’s bill.
title: ‘Trump Has Betrayed His Working-Class Voters’: What Our Conservative Writers Really Think of Trump’s Bill

author: Sachi Kitajima Mulkey
description: Power plant operators in Switzerland and France idled reactors so that discharged cooling water would not harm wildlife in already-hot rivers.
title: Extreme Heat Shuts Down Some Nuclear Reactors in Europe

author: Maxine Joselow
description: The letter had accused the Trump administration of politicizing, dismantling and sidelining the agency.
title: E.P.A. Suspends 144 Employees After They Signed a Letter Criticizing Trump

author: Alan Feuer
description: Edward Kelley had been convicted of plotting to kill the law enforcement officers who had investigated his case.
title: Pardoned Jan. 6 Rioter Sentenced to Life in Assassination Plot

author: John Leland
description: Richard J. Moylan has overseen a transformation of Green-Wood Cemetery in Brooklyn in his nearly 40 years as president. Now he’s ready to retire.
title: He Made Green-Wood Cemetery a Destination for the Living

author: Sydney Ember
description: The strength of the labor market suggests that the economy remains robust despite uncertainty caused by President Trump’s tariffs and geopolitical turmoil.
title: Hiring Held Steady in June as Employers Added 147,000 Jobs

author: Eshe Nelson
description: Central bankers who gathered in Portugal this week focused on ways that Europe could improve its competitiveness with the United States and China.
title: In Europe, Economists See a Chance to Rise on the Global Stage

author: Jesus Jiménez
description: Some communities in the Los Angeles region canceled events over fears of immigration raids, as Latinos grapple with how, and whether, to celebrate Independence Day.
title: They Planned Parties and Salsa Music for July 4th. ICE Raids Made Them Think Twice.

author: Mitch Smith, Julie Bosman and John Yoon
description: Gunfire from a passing car ripped into a crowd of clubgoers in the River North neighborhood, the police said.
title: 4 Dead, 14 Injured in Chicago Shooting Outside River North Lounge

author: Colby Smith
description: The latest labor market data reinforces the central bank’s wait-and-see approach to lowering borrowing costs, despite pressure from President Trump.
title: Solid Jobs Report Keeps Fed Rate Cuts at Bay

author: Wesley Morris, John White, Elyssa Dudley, Austin Mitchell, Kate LoPresti, Lisa Tobin and Efim Shapiro
description: But my mind is still racing.
title: The Diddy Trial Is Over But My Mind Is Still Racing

author: Michael Gold and Matthew Mpoke Bigg
description: Representative Hakeem Jeffries, the New York Democrat and minority leader, delayed a final House vote with an impassioned speech, saying he would take his “sweet time” assailing the measure.
title: Hakeem Jeffries Delays House Vote With Marathon Speech Opposing Trump’s Policy Bill

author: Alan Rappeport
description: The pyrotechnics industry relies heavily on Chinese fireworks imports and warns that this could be the last big bang Fourth of July.
title: How Trump’s China Tariffs Are Jeopardizing America’s Fireworks Extravaganzas

author: Nazaneen Ghaffar and Judson Jones
description: “Ideal” conditions are expected in the Northeast, but Florida and the Carolinas are warily eyeing a potential tropical system.
title: July 4 Weather Forecast Shows Heat and Storms Across the US

author: Penelope Green
description: She oversaw fashion coverage beginning in 1957, when hemlines made headlines. She later made groundbreaking ads for Henri Bendel with her photographer husband, Gösta Peterson.
title: Patricia Peterson, Innovative Fashion Editor at The Times, Dies at 99

author: Jacob Bernstein
description: The real-life inspiration for the famous toxic bachelor on “Sex and the City” left the Big Apple for the Green Mountain state.
title: Mr. Big Is Alive and Well and Married in Vermont

author: Abbie VanSickle
description: The court announced it would hear challenges to state laws barring transgender athletes from girls’ and women’s sports.
title: Supreme Court Agrees to Hear Cases Involving Transgender Athletes

author: Alexandra Stevenson
description: An initial trade deal with Vietnam offers a glimpse of how President Trump is pushing countries to cut back on trade with China.
title: Trump Wants the World to Squeeze Out China. He’s Starting With Vietnam.

author: Tyler Pager
description: President Trump has spent days cajoling Republicans to support his spending bill. He will also have to sell it to the public as Democrats focus on all the ways it helps the wealthy.
title: Trump’s Task as He Heads to Iowa: Selling His Bill to the American Public

author: Andrew Ross Sorkin, Bernhard Warner, Sarah Kessler, Michael J. de la Merced and Danielle Kaye
description: Robinhood is the latest to offer investors a novel, and potentially risky, investment opportunity: crypto that’s meant to give exposure to the likes of OpenAI.
title: Wall Street’s New Obsession (and Dilemma): Tokenizing Companies

author: Evan Gorelick
description: We explain how economists evaluate the national debt.
title: Sizing Up the Debt

author: Tracy Mumford, Will Jarvis, Ian Stewart, Jessica Metzger and Olivia Bensimon
description: Plus, Lululemon vs. Costco.
title: The Final Vote, and the Sean Combs Verdict

author: Julia Jacobs and Ben Sisario
description: The music mogul remains in custody after he was convicted on two counts of transporting prostitutes. A judge will determine his prison sentence at an unspecified date.
title: What’s Next in the Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Trial?

author: Julia Jacobs and Ben Sisario
description: In defusing much of the government’s case, lawyers for the music mogul did not dispute that he did bad things. They disputed that they matched the crimes he was charged with.
title: Sean Combs’s Winning Defense: He’s Abusive, but He’s Not a Racketeer

author: Jack Healy
description: Adelita Grijalva remains heavily favored to win the House seat of her late father, Raúl Grijalva, but youthful challengers and tired voters are asking why change is so hard for Democrats.
title: After Mamdani Mania, the Next Democratic Test Comes to Tucson

author: Noah Millman
description: A tax move from the Reagan era might explain what’s going on now.
title: What Are Republicans Thinking With Such a Reckless Bill? Maybe This.

author: Kate Shaw, William Baude and Stephen I. Vladeck
description: Grading how the Supreme Court has done so far in Trump 2.0.
title: ‘There’s Just Too Much Lawlessness’: Three Legal Experts on an Embattled Supreme Court

author: Jennifer Schuessler
description: This week, President Trump will start the countdown to next summer’s Semiquincentennial with an event at the Iowa State Fairgrounds. Not everyone wants to wave the flag his way.
title: Will Politics Derail America’s 250th Birthday Bash?

author: Ted Conover
description: Trump’s claim that Venezuelan criminals took over Aurora, Colorado, became a rationale for his immigration crackdown. What really happened there?
title: Democrats Denied This City Had a Gang Problem. The Truth Is Complicated.

author: Mohana Ravindranath
description: Alcohol can present health problems for even light or occasional drinkers.
title: How Drinking Alcohol Affects You in Older Age

author: Taylor Robinson
description: The Macy’s celebration, replete with 80,000 firework shells and 11 new pyrotechnic effects, returns to the East River after heading over to the Hudson in 2024.
title: Macy’s 4th of July Fireworks: Where to Watch in NYC

author: Stefanos Chen
description: The lowly New York City bus is getting new attention thanks to Zohran Mamdani’s vow to make the service free for all. But can free also mean fast?
title: Mamdani’s Win Has Put Buses in the Spotlight. Should They Be Free?

author: Michael Gold, Robert Jimison and Megan Mineiro
description: After a day of paralysis, the House remained frozen in place overnight as party leaders labored to address the concerns of Republican holdouts to the party’s major policy bill.
title: Trump Policy Bill Stalls as Johnson Works to Wear Down G.O.P. Resistance

author: John R. Bolton
description: It remains to be seen if Washington has learned enough of a lesson to destroy Iran’s remaining nuclear infrastructure.
title: John Bolton: We Need to Finish the Job in Iran

author: Liz Alderman and Violette Franchi
description: Hit by President Trump’s tariffs, the Saint James clothing factory has put its inventory of striped shirts and sweaters intended for U.S. retailers in its warehouse in France.
title: Hit by Trump’s Tariffs, French Clothing Maker Saint James Puts Shipping on Hold

author: Julia Jacobs, Karen Hanley, Melanie Bencosme, Gabriel Blanco and James Surdam
description: Sean Combs, the hip-hop mogul who built a business empire around his personal brand, was convicted on Wednesday of transporting prostitutes to participate in his drug-fueled sex marathons, but acquitted of racketeering and sex trafficking, the most serious charges against him. Julia Jacobs, a New York Times culture reporter, explains the verdict.
title: Sean Combs Acquitted of Sex Trafficking but Found Guilty on Lesser Charges

author: Kenneth Chang
description: 3I/ATLAS, earlier known as A11pI3Z, is only the third interstellar visitor to be discovered passing through our corner of the galaxy.
title: Third Interstellar Object, Comet 3I/ATLAS, Is Traveling Through Solar System

author: Aishvarya Kavi and Neil Vigdor
description: The plane, a Cessna 208B, went off the end of a runway as it was taking off from a small airport in Gloucester County, according to the F.A.A. Victims were being treated at the scene, officials said.
title: Skydiving Plane With 15 Aboard Crashes on Takeoff in New Jersey
